div.head: Experiment title:
div.p: Effects of Co distribution and promoters such as Mn and Re on the reduction behaviour of single particle Co-based Fischer-Tropsch Synthesis Catalysts

div.head: Report:
div.p: A series of reductions, presented in the table below, were carried out on 10%Co/(Mn)TiO2 samples on the ID31 beamline at the ESRF. For each experiment, three catalyst trilobes were mounted on top of each other in a capillary (see photography on page 2).

The data shows a difference in reduction over the three extrudates placed in a single capillary. Even in such small amounts of catalysts, the Figure below shows this difference on the experiment at 4 % and 100 % of H2 at the space velocity of 5000 h-1. The intensity of the most reduced species decrease with the increasing amount of extrudates. This difference of reduction could be explain by a gradual increase of H2O concentration along the reactor during the reduction.

div.head: Figure:
div.p: Diffractograms of Co/TiO2 after the experiment at 4% and 100% of H2 at the space velocity of 5000 h-1 of three extrudates of the catalyst 10%Co/(Mn)TiO2 (C1313678); blue: top pellet, red: middle pellet, yellow: bottom pellet.
The work is currently being prepared for publication.
